main event: A bright object was observed in the sky over Trotwood, Ohio on April 11, 1967.
interesting points: The object appeared as a bright star that turned red as it approached the horizon.
The object disappeared by fading out of sight, lasting for around 3 hours.
The witness was certain about the time of the sighting and that the object was in sight continuously.
The witness described the object as having lights that changed colors and at times nearly disappearing before reappearing.
The witness felt the object was more of a natural phenomenon than man-made.
sighted object: a bright, star-like object that changed color
